text: Monteagle "Monty" Stearns (December 5, 1924 - May 14, 2016) was an American diplomat. He was the former Ambassador to Côte d'Ivoire (Ivory Coast) (1976–79) and Greece (1981–85). He worked for Presidents Gerald Ford, Jimmy Carter and Ronald Reagan. Stearns was born in Cambridge, Massachusetts. He was a member of the American Academy of Diplomacy and Council on Foreign Relations. Stearns died on May 14, 2016 in Belmont, Massachusetts at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:People from Cambridge, Massachusetts Category:Politicians from Massachusetts Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
